title: Council Decision of 18 February 2003 appointing members of the Advisory Committee of the Euratom Supply Agency
header:
Council Decision
of 18 February 2003
appointing members of the Advisory Committee of the Euratom Supply Agency
(2003/C 50/01)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Atomic Energy Community, and in particular the second and third paragraphs of Article 54 thereof,
Having regard to Article X of the Statutes of the Euratom Supply Agency(1),as last amended by Decision 95/1/EC, Euratom, ECSC of 1 January 1995(2),
Having regard to the Council Decision of 27 September 2001 appointing the members of the Advisory Committee of the Euratom Supply Agency(3),
Having regard to the opinion of the Commission,
Whereas:
(1) Three members' seats on the aforementioned Committee have fallen vacant following the resignation of Mr Javier Arana, Mr Javier Villalba and Mr José Luis González, which was brought to the Council's attention on 2 October 2002.
(2) Those vacancies should be filled.
(3) Having regard to the nominations submitted by the Spanish Government on 2 October 2002,
main_body: Mr José Manuel Redondo, Mr Eduardo González and Mr Germán García Calderón are hereby appointed members of the Advisory Committee of the Euratom Supply Agency for the remainder of the Committee's term of office, i.e. until 28 March 2003.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 February 2003.
For the Council
The President
N. Christodoulakis
(1) OJ 27, 6.12.1958, p. 534/58.
(2) OJ L 1, 1.1.1995, p. 1.
(3) OJ C 281, 5.10.2001, p. 3.
